metadata.title: CVE-2022-48810 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ipmr,ip6mr: acquire RTNL before calling ip[6]mr_free_table() on failurepathip[6]mr_free_table() can only be called under RTNL lock.RTNL: assertion failed at net/core/dev.c (10367)WARNING: CPU: 1 PID: 5890 at net/core/dev.c:10367unregister_netdevice_many+0x1246/0x1850 net/core/dev.c:10367Modules linked in:CPU: 1 PID: 5890 Comm: syz-executor.2 Not tainted5.16.0-syzkaller-11627-g422ee58dc0ef #0Hardware name: Google Google Compute Engine/Google Compute Engine, BIOSGoogle 01/01/2011RIP: 0010:unregister_netdevice_many+0x1246/0x1850 net/core/dev.c:10367Code: 0f 85 9b ee ff ff e8 69 07 4b fa ba 7f 28 00 00 48 c7 c6 00 90 ae 8a48 c7 c7 40 90 ae 8a c6 05 6d b1 51 06 01 e8 8c 90 d8 01 <0f> 0b e9 70 eeff ff e8 3e 07 4b fa 4c 89 e7 e8 86 2a 59 fa e9 eeRSP: 0018:ffffc900046ff6e0 EFLAGS: 00010286RAX: 0000000000000000 RBX: 0000000000000000 RCX: 0000000000000000RDX: ffff888050f51d00 RSI: ffffffff815fa008 RDI: fffff520008dfeceRBP: 0000000000000000 R08: 0000000000000000 R09: 0000000000000000R10: ffffffff815f3d6e R11: 0000000000000000 R12: 00000000fffffff4R13: dffffc0000000000 R14: ffffc900046ff750 R15: ffff88807b7dc000FS:  00007f4ab736e700(0000) GS:ffff8880b9d00000(0000)knlGS:0000000000000000CS:  0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033CR2: 00007fee0b4f8990 CR3: 000000001e7d2000 CR4: 00000000003506e0DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1: 0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400Call Trace: <TASK> mroute_clean_tables+0x244/0xb40 net/ipv6/ip6mr.c:1509 ip6mr_free_table net/ipv6/ip6mr.c:389 [inline] ip6mr_rules_init net/ipv6/ip6mr.c:246 [inline] ip6mr_net_init net/ipv6/ip6mr.c:1306 [inline] ip6mr_net_init+0x3f0/0x4e0 net/ipv6/ip6mr.c:1298 ops_init+0xaf/0x470 net/core/net_namespace.c:140 setup_net+0x54f/0xbb0 net/core/net_namespace.c:331 copy_net_ns+0x318/0x760 net/core/net_namespace.c:475 create_new_namespaces+0x3f6/0xb20 kernel/nsproxy.c:110 copy_namespaces+0x391/0x450 kernel/nsproxy.c:178 copy_process+0x2e0c/0x7300 kernel/fork.c:2167 kernel_clone+0xe7/0xab0 kernel/fork.c:2555 __do_sys_clone+0xc8/0x110 kernel/fork.c:2672 do_syscall_x64 arch/x86/entry/common.c:50 [inline] do_syscall_64+0x35/0xb0 arch/x86/entry/common.c:80 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x44/0xaeRIP: 0033:0x7f4ab89f9059Code: Unable to access opcode bytes at RIP 0x7f4ab89f902f.RSP: 002b:00007f4ab736e118 EFLAGS: 00000206 ORIG_RAX: 0000000000000038RAX: ffffffffffffffda RBX: 00007f4ab8b0bf60 RCX: 00007f4ab89f9059RDX: 0000000020000280 RSI: 0000000020000270 RDI: 0000000040200000RBP: 00007f4ab8a5308d R08: 0000000020000300 R09: 0000000020000300R10: 00000000200002c0 R11: 0000000000000206 R12: 0000000000000000R13: 00007ffc3977cc1f R14: 00007f4ab736e300 R15: 0000000000022000 </TASK>

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186
linux-image-4.15.0-177-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-177.186
linux-image-4.15.0-177-lowlatency - 4.15.0-177.186
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-lowlatency - 4.15.0-177.186
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-177.186').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-110.124~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1114.117').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1128.137').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1075.80~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1078.81~18.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1085.94').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2067.70').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2049.53').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2032.35').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').
linux-gcp-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.136').
linux-gcp-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.4').
linux-gcp-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1073.78~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gke-5.0').
linux-gke-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-gkeop-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1021.23~18.04.1').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.102').
linux-oracle-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.3').
linux-oracle-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.4').
linux-oracle-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1071.77~18.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1060.68~18.04.1').
